YouTuber Hank Green’s Focus Friend app, which topped the Apple App Store charts earlier this year, gives users a little bean on their phones that knits more items the longer the user keeps away from certain blocked apps. Also generating buzz this year was a small app-blocking device called the Brick, which locks users out of distracting apps and websites until they touch their phones to the Brick to deactivate the locks.

“I think we’re all craving to just get back into community and real life, like real, tangible relationships. Everyone’s so online now that it’s hurting my soul,” said Maddie DeVico, a small-business owner in Colorado. “There’s a huge movement here. I think the culture is starting to shift and people are realizing how detrimental being constantly connected can be for your mental health at the end of the day.”

To combat her own social media addiction, DeVico, 31, took some clay and molded a physical dock for her to “hang up” her cellphone like a landline when she has no pressing need for it. It reminded her of her childhood, when phones were tied to a designated place, like the kitchen wall.

When she shared the idea on TikTok this summer, a wave of viewers responded by creating and posting about their own copycat phone docks. Now, DeVico said, she hangs up her phone in its clay dock every night. She tries to implement phone-free mornings and phone-free dinners, as well as a few phone-free zones in her home.

Aside from finding more time for hobbies such as writing, painting and cooking, DeVico said, the habit has also enabled her to get excited about the little things again — like spotting a roly-poly in her garden.

Others have touted similar attempts to physically separate themselves from their phones. One writer, Tiffany Ng, chronicled her experience chaining her phone to the wall for a week. Tech founder Cat Goetze, who goes by CatGPT online, built a Bluetooth-compatible landline phone and surpassed $120,000 in sales within the first three days of its July launch.

What many people misunderstand about the no-phone movement, Goetze said, is that it doesn’t require an all-or-nothing approach: “There’s a lot of people who say: ‘Just get a flip phone. Take this supercomputer, chuck it into the ocean and go back to the ’90s and just get a dumb phone again.’”

“What I realized is that the thing that actually works is balance, and balance doesn’t mean getting rid of your smartphone,” Goetze said. “It’s about putting external factors in place that make your smartphone less easily accessible at all times.”
But people aren’t just detoxing from their phones to boost productivity. For many, learning how to have analog fun is just as much the goal.

As DeVico put it, “grandma hobbies are so back.” Tutorials on crocheting, knitting, scrapbooking and other forms of crafting have found sustained success on platforms like TikTok and Instagram. Meanwhile, social clubs organized around everything from books to running to mahjong have exploded in popularity in recent years.

Shun Hawkins, 31, loves junk journaling. In her analog bag, she packs stickers, washi tape and fashion magazine clippings to collage. She brings the bag out when she wants to immerse herself in a day of crafting, keeping a doodle book and a Nickelodeon-themed coloring book complete with a box of colored pencils and felt-tip pens inside.

“It’s reawakened something in me that I feel like I lost a long time ago. I didn’t even go to school for something that I’m passionate about. And now, being 31, being at home and being able to do things like junk journaling and doodling again, that’s reigniting this passion for me — even wanting to go back to school just to take on fashion,” said Hawkins, who lives in Tennessee. “Something like that, I feel like it wouldn’t be possible if I wasn’t detaching myself from social media.”

Another silver lining for Hawkins: More crafting has meant less doomscrolling. One recent morning, she found herself reorganizing the trinkets in her room upon waking up instead of immediately reaching for her phone.
Add NBC News to Google
Add NBC News to Google
The urge to go analog has also become a selling point at social events and in nightlife.

Hush Harbor, a cocktail bar in Washington, D.C., began offering its patrons a rare experience by prohibiting cellphones within the establishment to encourage people to be more present and better connect with their communities.
Christa Eduafo, a New York-based DJ who goes by DJ Chvmeleon, has also had success with her monthly phone-free parties, which she launched in June.
The goal, she said, is to revive a culture in which people feel comfortable enough to dance and let loose without fearing that they might be photographed or recorded by a stranger.

“There’s more of an interest in capturing a moment to post later than experiencing a moment in real time, and that’s impacting the real-time experience,” Eduafo said. “So it’s almost like everyone’s going to an event or to a bar because maybe they saw it on TikTok and they saw that there might be a moment they could capture and post themselves. But if there’s a room full of people waiting for something to capture, then there’s nothing to capture.”

Goetze, who also hosted a “no-phone party” in Los Angeles this fall that drew more than 700 people, said the concept forced people to interact with one another without being able to pull out their phones as a social crutch. She noted that it made the experience “one of the most present events that I have attended in a really long time.”
She plans a small tour of no-phone parties elsewhere next year. It has become clearer than ever, she said, that people are desperate to form real-life connections again.

"They're craving the ability to be present with others. It shows up in every aspect of our lives. And we’re going to get there through a variety of different factors,” Goetze said. “We’re going to get there through physical events; we’re going to get there through reconnecting with our hobbies and spending time in groups. And I do feel very strongly that the solution is not just about getting rid of something. You have to add something new.”

title: 'Big Brother' star Mickey Lee dies at 35, family says
summary: “Big Brother” alum Mickey Lee died on Thursday after suffering multiple cardiac arrests following flu complications, according to her family.
story: “Big Brother” alum Mickey Lee died on Thursday after suffering multiple cardiac arrests following flu complications, according to her family. She was 35.
Lee’s family announced her death on Friday, making a statement on the former “Big Brother” star’s Instagram account.

“Mickey captured the hearts of audiences nationwide through her appearance on Big Brother, where her authenticity, strength, and spirit left a lasting impression on fans and fellow cast members alike,” they wrote. “She will be remembered for the joy she brought into the lives of so many and for the genuine connections she formed both on and off screen.”

Earlier this week, Lee’s family created a GoFundMe account for the reality star’s “medical journey,” saying that the funds were needed to pay for medical expenses not covered by insurance. The family raised over $32,500 as of Friday afternoon.
Lee suffered multiple cardiac arrests following complications from the flu, according to the GoFundMe page, and was in critical but stable condition earlier this week.
She is originally from Jacksonville, Florida, and was living in Atlanta, according to the GoFundMe page.
Lee starred on Season 27 of “Big Brother,” which aired on CBS this year.
“Mickey’s light, legacy, and impact will never be forgotten,” her family wrote.

title: The Cure Guitarist and Keyboardist Perry Bamonte Dies at 65
summary: Perry Bamonte, a guitarist and keyboardist for the legendary British goth rock band The Cure, has died
story: Perry Bamonte, a guitarist and keyboardist for the legendary British goth rock band The Cure, has died.
Bamonte passed away “after a short illness at home over Christmas,” the band announced in a statement Dec. 26 on the official The Cure website. He was 65.

The band’s members, who referred to Bamonte by the nickname “Teddy,” described him as “quiet, intense, intuitive” and “hugely creative,” and said he was “a warm hearted and vital part of The Cure story.”
“Our thoughts and condolences are with all his family. He will be very greatly missed,” they added.

The London-born Bamonte worked with The Cure in various capacities from 1984 until 1989 before officially joining the band as a keyboardist,  guitarist and occasional six-string bassist in 1990, the band said. He first appeared on the band’s 1992 album “Wish,” which featured the Billboard Top 20 hit song ″Friday I’m in Love.”
In 2005, The Cure's leader, singer and guitarist Robert Smith, dismissed Bamonte and keyboardist Roger O'Donnell in order to reshape the band as a three-piece, Billboard reported at the time.
In 2019, Bamonte reunited with members of The Cure when the band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
He rejoined The Cure in 2022 and can be seen performing onstage in the band's concert film “The Cure: The Show of a Lost World,” released this month.
Outside of his work with The Cure, Bamonte played bass in the British band Love Amongst Ruin, which featured former Placebo member Steve Hewitt on drums.

title: How to Watch Snoop Dogg's NFL Christmas Gameday Special 'Snoop's Holiday Halftime Party'
summary: Here is how you can tune into Snoop Dogg's "Holiday Halftime Party" on Netflix after it aired during the Christmas Day game between the Vikings and Lions.
story: Football and music fans had something extra fun to look forward to when they watched Netflix's NFL Christmas Gameday.

On Dec. 25, Snoop Dogg took the lead in getting people on their feet during the football games that took place on Dec. 25. The rapper, along with special celebrity guests, entertained viewers during “Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party.”
Live from U.S. Bank Stadium in Minneapolis, Minnesota, after the Cowboys beat the Commanders 30-23 and during the Lions vs Vikings game, Snoop headlined the game’s halftime show.
During Christmas Day, each team wore a festive, holiday-inspired patch on their uniform in both their Week 16 and Christmas Day games, according to Netflix.
This year’s jersey patch consisted of the NFL shield backed by two candy canes.

Last year, the streaming service kicked off its inaugural Christmas Gameday with what was dubbed “Beyoncé Bowl,” which featured Beyoncé performing at halftime during the Ravens vs. Texas game. The performance was later added to Netflix for viewers to rewatch or catch for the first time if they missed it.
Continue reading on how you can tune into “Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party” so you can rewatch or catch for the first time.
What Is 'Snoop's Holiday Halftime Party'?
“Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party” was the special halftime show during Netflix’s NFL Christmas Gameday on Dec. 25.
Snoop was joined by the singing voices of HUNTR/X, which consists of Ejae, Audrey Nuna and Rei Ami from the hit animated movie “K-Pop Demon Hunters.”

Lainey Wilson also delivered a festive performance during the halftime show. Additionally, people were in for a holiday treat when Southern soul’s star Tonio Armani took the stage, as well as Andrea Bocelli and son Matteo Bocelli who closed the celebration with “White Christmas.”
Snoop was also joined by a 30 person choir, drummer boys and 30 snoopette dancers as he performed “My Favorite Things,” “G Thang” and “Drop it Like it’s Hot.”
Others included in the special were funk icon George Clinton and Martha Stewart.
How to Watch ‘Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party’
“Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party” streamed live on Netflix on Christmas, Dec. 25.
Additionally, the Netflix Christmas Day games aired on CBS affiliates in the competing team cities and be available on U.S. mobile devices with NFL+, according to the press release.
But if people missed the live event, the halftime show is now available as a standalone special on Netflix on Dec. 26, 2025.
What Time Does ‘Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party’ Air?
“Snoop’s Holiday Halftime Party” first took place during the Lions vs. Vikings game on Dec. 25.
Is it now available to stream on Netflix.
Netflix streamed two NFC match-ups during the holiday, with  the Cowboys beating the Commanders 30-23 and the Lions losing to the Vikings 23-10.

title: Mickey Lee of ‘Big Brother’ Season 27 Dies After ‘Series of Cardiac Arrests’ From Flu Complications
summary: Mickey Lee, a contestant on "Big Brother" Season 27, has died at age 35 following complications she experienced from the flu, which left her hospitalized.
story: Mickey Lee, a contestant on "Big Brother" Season 27, has died. She was 35.
Lee's family announced the news in a statement they shared on her verified Instagram account Dec. 26.

"With profound sadness, the family of Mickey Lee announces her transition on Christmas in the early evening. Mickey captured the hearts of audiences nationwide through her appearance on 'Big Brother,' where her authenticity, strength and spirit left a lasting impression on fans and fellow cast members alike," the statement read.

"She will be remembered for the joy she brought into the lives of so many and for the genuine connections she formed both on and off screen," it continued. "The family extends their deepest gratitude to everyone who has offered prayers, love, and support during this incredibly difficult time. Your kindness has been felt and is sincerely appreciated."

At the end of the statement, Lee's family asked social media users for "privacy during this critical time of bereavement." They added that they will share details about Lee's memorial services and arrangements at a later date.

News of Lee's death comes just days after her family shared that Lee had experienced a “series of cardiac arrests” following complications from the flu. In the Dec. 22 statement, Lee's family said she was hospitalized in the ICU "in critical but stable condition." The family also set up a GoFundMe to cover her medical expenses.
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Harvard Health Publishing, studies have found there is an increased risk of heart disease after a bout of the flu.

"A growing body of research suggests that influenza virus infection itself could put people at increased risk for acute cardiovascular events, like heart attack and stroke," a page on the CDC website states.
Lee, an event curator who was based in Atlanta, competed on Season 27 of "Big Brother," which aired from July to September 2025. She was the eighth housemate to be evicted from the show.
Fellow contestant Rachel Reilly mourned Lee in the comments section, writing, "Sorry for your loss and my prayers for your family RIP MICKEY you are missed — love to all of you."

title: Where Jonathan and Nancy's Relationship Stands Now After 'Stranger Things' Season 5
summary: Are Jonathan and Nancy Still Together After That Conversation in "Stranger Things" Season 5, Vol. 2?
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead of Season 5, Vol. 2, of "Stranger Things."
Jonathan Byers and Nancy Wheeler finally cleared the air on the status of their relationship after two seasons of tension.

Jonathan (Charlie Heaton) and Nancy (Natalia Dyer) have been together since their first kiss in Season 2 of the hit Netflix supernatural show. But during Season 4, when the characters navigated long distance — Jonathan in Lenora, California, and Nancy still in Hawkins — the couple appeared to no longer be on the same page.

That continued in Season 5. Despite both being back in Hawkins, Jonathan kept from Nancy that he didn't apply to Emerson College along with her. However, he's carrying around an engagement ring. Nancy, meanwhile, finds herself leading the team's covert operations in the Upside Down while navigating affection from not only Jonathan but her first boyfriend, Steve Harrington (Joe Keery).

Finally, during the new batch of episodes released Christmas Day, Nancy and Jonathan had a real conversation about their relationship while trapped in a room rapidly filling with an indeterminable liquid in the Upside Down.
Are Nancy and Jonathan Broken up?
Yes, according to the show's creators, Matt and Ross Duffer, Jonathan and Nancy broke up during that conversation.
“That’s a breakup,” Matt Duffer told People. “They are broken up.”
But you'd be forgiven if their current relationship status didn't seem clear.
The moment of brutal honesty starts with Nancy admitting to Jonathan she doesn't like The Clash, his favorite band. He throws back that he hates reading her articles.

Things took a more somber note when she reveals that she didn’t visit Lenora over spring break way back in Season 4 because she felt she needed “space.” They also tearfully discuss how their relationship came about through shared trauma, a facet they agreed was “suffocating.”

When Jonathan asks if her feelings of distance came from lingering feelings for Steve, she references the fact that her ex wants six kids. Unlike her former flame, she says she doesn’t know what she wants.
Finally, Jonathan decides to do “one thing right” and reveal the ring he’d been keeping in a John Coltrane cassette tape case. But instead of proposing, he asks Nancy to “not-marry” him.

She accepts his “un-proposal.” Rounding out the bittersweet moment, they realize they aren’t about to drown in thick goo. Rather, the liquid had hardened, offering a temporary reprieve from the chaos in the Upside Down.
Even though their conversation ended with an exchange of “I love yous” and an intimate hug, the Duffer brothers confirm the couple is no longer together.
The decision to break up the longtime couple was made to give Nancy “an opportunity to find herself,” Matt Duffer told People.

“It’s hard to recall when exactly that idea came, but I think us — and the writers — all felt that Nancy needed to end up on her own and be independent and have an opportunity to find herself,” he said.
“I mean, how many people wind up with their girlfriend or boyfriend that they met in high school?” he added.
The series finale of “Stranger Things” drops Dec. 31 at 8 p.m. ET/ 5 p.m. PT with the final episode of Season 5, titled “The Rightside Up.”

title: What Happens in the ‘Heated Rivalry’ Sequel, ‘The Long Game’?
summary: Already miss "Heated Rivalry"? Here's what to know about Season 2 and what happens in the book's sequel, "The Long Game."
story: Warning: This article contains light spoilers for the end of "Heated Rivalry."
Enjoy your time at the cottage?
The "Heated Rivalry" finale officially hit HBO Max in the U.S. on Dec. 26, bringing fans of Canadian streamer Crave's unexpected hit hockey romance drama a long-awaited conclusion — at least for now.
The six-episode series, which premiered Nov. 28, was officially renewed for a second season halfway through its airing.

"Heated Rivalry," which is based on the 2019 novel by Canadian author Rachel Reid, follows eight years in the professional and personal lives of two rival hockey stars, Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) and Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie). Behind the scenes of their storied rivalry, the two embark on a longstanding sexual relationship and, over tuna melts and texts, fall in love.

The season finale left Shane and Ilya content with their official relationship, but potential obstacles abound: Neither are out to their teams or the world and the plan is to keep the relationship secret for the indefinite future.
The show's ending closely aligns with the book's ending. But thanks to Reid, their story continues in a 2022 sequel, "The Long Game."
Here's what to know about what happens next in Shane and Ilya's story.
What Happens In 'The Long Game'?
Major spoilers ahead for Rachel Reid's 2022 novel, "The Long Game."
"The Long Game" picks up a few years after "Heated Rivalry's" epilogue ended with Shane and Ilya in a happy, but secret, relationship while each continues their own hockey careers.

Ilya has established himself as a star player on a struggling Ottawa team, while Shane is still playing for Montreal, putting the distance between their teams' cities at only about two hours. They've also established the appearance of a public friendship by establishing a joint charity.

But the weight of keeping their relationship a secret gradually grows on Ilya throughout the sequel. "The Long Game" is set during their 11th season of "hiding," as Ilya puts it — seven of secret hookups and three in a "mostly secret committed relationship."

And after moving from Boston to Ottawa, Shane's hometown, to be closer to him, Ilya's hockey ambitions start to take less of a priority, especially in comparison to Shane, who remains locked in on securing another Stanley Cup and solidifying his legacy with Montreal.

The book also follows Ilya's recurring dreams of his mother, who died by suicide when he was 12. It's revealed she experienced severe depression, and Ilya pursues therapy, though he initially keeps it from Shane. He is eventually diagnosed with depression, as he and Shane grow further apart, culminating in a fight where Ilya accuses Shane of picking hockey over his partner.

But never fear, Hollanov does not break up. After their fight, Ilya's team plane has to make an emergency landing. His brush with a crash reminds Shane and Ilya how much they mean to each other. They reconcile, and Shane proposes.

They also set a timeline to come out, but their plans are upended when they are spotted kissing in the background of a video that goes viral. While the league pressures them into releasing a statement claiming the clip was a prank, they refuse. The couple posts a photo together and opens up about their relationship on social media, on their own terms.

The book ends with Shane and Ilya getting married and on the same page about wanting children. And in an epilogue, it's revealed Shane joined Ottawa, meaning the newlyweds will consistently play on the same team for the first time.
Will Season 2 of 'Heated Rivalry' Be Based on 'The Long Game'?
Good question.
A synopsis or premise is not yet available for "Heated Rivalry" Season 2, but creator Jacob Tierney has confirmed that the next run of episodes will continue Shane and Ilya's story.
“We’re following Shane and Ilya. That’s not gonna be a shock," he previously told Entertainment Weekly.
And in a video announcing Season 2 for HBO Max, Storrie told viewers, "Start reading 'The Long Game' if you want spoilers."
When Does Season 2 of 'Heated Rivalry' Come Out?
Now for the bad news.
While the Season 2 renewal news dropped less than a month after the show's premiere, it's likely to take much, much longer to bring that sequel to fans.
Speaking with Variety, Tierney confirmed that Season 2 will not drop this time in 2026.

“It can’t be same time next year, because this time last year I’d written five of these, and this time this year I’ve written zero of them,” Tierney said. “So it’s going to be a little bit later, but it’s still going to be soon.”
He added that his goal is balancing quality with timeliness.

“We understand that everybody’s goal is to not do two years between seasons,” he said. “And at the same time, I don’t want to put out a rushed s---- second season just because the show is very popular. But we’re very aware that our creative partners are enthusiastic and don’t want to wait too long. We’re getting back to work!”
What Happens to Shane and Ilya After 'The Long Game'?
While there are six books in Reid's "Game Changers" series, only "Heated Rivalry" and "The Long Game" spotlight Shane and Ilya.
Reid acknowledged that the ending of "The Long Game" left the two beloved characters at an "interesting point," and she confirmed to TODAY.com that she is working on ideas for more stories.
"They never leave my head. I think my other characters do, but those guys stay with me," Reid said.
"I do have story ideas. Some of them I’m working on, I’m trying to figure out what to do with them, but there’s going to be something," she aded. "You’ll see something for sure."

title: Snoop Dogg Brought out K-Pop, Country and Opera Stars for Memorable Holiday Halftime Show
summary: Fans react to Snoop Dogg's halftime show at the Christmas Day game between the Detroit Lions and Minnesota Vikings.
story: The Christmas Day game between the Detroit Lions and Minnesota Vikings was a real Dogg fight.
While the Vikings won the game, 23-10, and officially knocked the Lions out of playoff contention, the real story may have been Snoop Dogg’s epic halftime show.

The rapper performed at Minnesota’s U.S. Bank Stadium with country star Lainey Wilson and HUNTR/X of “Kpop Demon Hunters” fame. Italian tenor Andrea Bocelli and his son, Matteo, came out and joined them all to sing “White Christmas.”
Snoop was introduced by pal Martha Stewart, who read a humorous version of “Twas the Night Before Christmas,” tailored to the “Gin and Juice” singer.

During the "Holiday Halftime Party" special, the rapper was accompanied by a 30-person choir, drummer and a team of dancers while he performed several of his hits, including “Nuthin’ but a G Thang,” “Who Am I (What’s My Name)?” and “Drop it Like it’s Hot.”
HUNTR/X performed “12 Days of Christmas” and Wilson electrified the crowd with “Santa Claus is Coming to Town.”
That all led to the Bocellis taking the stage for “White Christmas.”
Snoop sported a bright red suit and overcoat, standing out against the white ensembles his collaborators wore.

“NFL, Netflix, and your Uncle Snoop on Christmas Day?” Snoop said about his show. “We’re servin’ up music, love, and good vibes for the whole world to enjoy. That’s holiday magic Santa can’t fit in a bag.”
Viewers on X who tuned into Netflix to see the game were in awe.
“Elmo loves your outfit Mr. Snoop Dogg!” the account for Elmo wrote.
“The Netflix/Snoop Dogg halftime show is better than the last three Super Bowl halftime shows combined,” raved one fan.
“King. Icon. Legend.Hands down one of the greatest halftime shows ever. There’s a reason @SnoopDogg is one of the most beloved American entertainers of all time,” gushed Meghan McCain.
“Snoop Dogg with the greatest Halftime Show of All Time,” commented another fan.
“Who knew the half time show for the Lions Vikings game would be better than the Superbowl? Snoop Dogg is the truth!” someone  else wrote.
“SNOOP’S HOLIDAY HALFTIME PARTY WAS AMAZING,” approved the NFL.
“One of the greatest performances of All Time,” NFL reporter Dov Kleiman wrote.

title: Céline Dion Sings 'All By Myself' for Christmas ... As the Grinch
summary: Céline Dion gave her fans a special Christmas message this year. The singer dressed up as the Grinch and re-created a scene from "How the Grinch Stole Christmas."
story: Céline Dion underwent a Christmas transformation.
For Christmas, Dion dressed up as the Grinch and re-created a scene from the classic Dr. Seuss tale and 2000 family flick, “How the Grinch Stole Christmas."

In a video shared to Instagram, Dion sits next to a fireplace and croons her hit song “All by Myself" before she talks about her schedule for the day, delivering a perfect impression of the Jim Carrey character.

“The nerve of those Whos. Inviting me on such short notice. Even if I wanted to go, my schedule wouldn’t allow it,” she said, putting her own spin on beloved quotes from the Christmas film. “4:00, exercise my voice. 4:30, wake my children up. 5, solve world hunger, tell no one. 5:30, jazzercize. 6:30, dinner with me, I can’t cancel that again! 7, wrestle with my creative ideas. I’m booked!”
(Dion added she could possibly bump her creative ideating to 9 so she could have time to "lay in bed and scroll TikTok videos endlessly.")
“Or I can just simply wish everyone a merry Christmas and a Happy New Year," she said, before yelling out, "Boring!"
On Instagram, people said they adored Dion's impression.
"This wins best video of the year," one person said.
Another added, "LOL she’s the absolute best! This will be a hard Christmas message to beat!"

Dion, who has been open about her diagnosis with and treatment for the rare neurological disorder stiff person syndrome, also shared another video for her fans this Christmas. In this one, she wished viewers a heartfelt merry Christmas.

"My dear friends, whether you're surrounded by family living far away or finding quiet moments to yourself, well, I hope your heart feels full of hope and joy today," she said. "May your holiday be filled with peace, laughter and memories that warm your soul wherever you may be in the world. From my family to yours, merry Christmas!"

title: You Can Soon Buy or Rent ‘Wicked: For Good’ — With 6 Deleted Scenes
summary: Learn how to rent or buy "Wicked: For Good," releasing on digital and DVD this December.
story: There's no place like home to watch "Wicked: For Good."
The blockbuster sequel will be available to buy or rent at home over the holidays after raking in nearly $500 million worldwide in theaters, and it will be packed with extras.
Here's what to know about the release of the film on digital platforms as well as a separate release for the 4K UHD, Blu-ray and DVD versions.
When Can You Buy or Rent "Wicked: For Good"?
You can rejoicify at the sequel to the hit Broadway musical adaption just ahead of the new year on Dec. 30, when it will be available to buy or rent on digital platforms.
When Does "Wicked: For Good" Come Out in 4K and on DVD?
Versions of the movie in 4K UHD, Blu-ray and DVD will be released on Jan. 20, 2026.
What Extras Are Included?
The version available for rent or purchase features two versions of the movie, an exclusive sing-a-long and an hour of bonus features, according to Universal Pictures Home Entertainment.
A 50-minute feature is included that details the making of the movie with stars Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande, the rest of the cast and director Jon M. Chu.
There also is a closer look at the creation of two new songs for the movie, “No Place Like Home” and “The Girl in the Bubble," featuring interviews with Erivo and Grande.
Plus, there’s a deeper look into Kiamo Ko, the floating castle and home of Elphaba, where the film concludes with an ending that put a bit of a twist on the original one in the Broadway musical.
What Are the Deleted Scenes?
There are six deleted scenes among the bonus goodies, featuring characters from the Munchkins to Jeff Goldblum's Wonderful Wizard of Oz.
They are as follows:

A Glinda train tour in which the citizens of Emerald City send Grande’s character off in style with a song as her assistants, played by Bowen Yang and Bronwyn James, try to help her out by signing her autograph for fans. A musical montage of the Munchkins making the bricks that form the Yellow Brick Road. A scene in which Elphaba (Erivo) retreats to her lair to wrestle with Fiyero’s betrayal and her heartbreak. Fiyero is a prince played by Jonathan Bailey. Elphaba returns to her childhood home of the Governor's Mansion when she swore she would never go back. A friendship montage of Elphaba, Glinda, Fiyero, Boq (Ethan Slater) and Nessarose (Marissa Bode) playing games and laughing over a picnic. Glinda floating over Emerald City in her bubble while the Wizard of Oz floats in his hot air balloon and reprises the song "A Sentimental Man" that was in the original "Wicked" movie.

A Glinda train tour in which the citizens of Emerald City send Grande’s character off in style with a song as her assistants, played by Bowen Yang and Bronwyn James, try to help her out by signing her autograph for fans.
A musical montage of the Munchkins making the bricks that form the Yellow Brick Road.
A scene in which Elphaba (Erivo) retreats to her lair to wrestle with Fiyero’s betrayal and her heartbreak. Fiyero is a prince played by Jonathan Bailey.
Elphaba returns to her childhood home of the Governor's Mansion when she swore she would never go back.
A friendship montage of Elphaba, Glinda, Fiyero, Boq (Ethan Slater) and Nessarose (Marissa Bode) playing games and laughing over a picnic.
Glinda floating over Emerald City in her bubble while the Wizard of Oz floats in his hot air balloon and reprises the song "A Sentimental Man" that was in the original "Wicked" movie.

title: ‘Stranger Things’ Star Noah Schnapp Breaks Down That Emotional Will Moment: 'It Was Perfect'
summary: "Stranger Things" star Noah Schnapp discusses his character Will's emotional monologue with his friends and family in Season 5, Vol. 2
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for “Stranger Things” Season 5, Vol. 2.
It’s been a period of growth for Will on “Stranger Things,” and this fifth and final season pushes him to come out of his comfort zone.

Episode 7, titled “The Bridge,” includes an emotional monologue when Noah Schnapp’s character, Will, comes out to his family and friends. Just as the crew plans their fight against Vecna (Jamie Campbell Bower), Will decides to tell those closest to him that he doesn’t like girls.

Sitting down and looking at his best friend Mike (played by Finn Wolfhard), mom Joyce (Winona Ryder), brother Jonathan (Charlie Heaton) and more, Will is his most vulnerable self. After making it clear that he is gay, his friends and family proudly support him and tell him they will always be by his side.
The moment, Schnapp tells TODAY.com, was “nerve-wracking.”

“It was a lot of pressure. The whole cast being there, I did not  expect the scene to happen that way. I thought it was just going to be me and Joyce, and that’s already nerve-wracking,” Schnapp says. “So to have everyone standing there watching was really nerve-wracking in a lot of different ways.”
In 2022, after Season 4 dropped, Schnapp told Variety that Will was in love with Mike.

“I mean, it’s pretty clear this season that Will has feelings for Mike,” he said at the time. “They’ve been intentionally pulling that out over the past few seasons. Even in Season 1, they hinted at that and slowly, slowly grew that storyline.”
“Now it’s 100% clear that he is gay and he does love Mike," he added.

In Season 5, Will has been curious about sharing his feelings with his friends and family after he sees Robin (Maya Hawke) kissing her girlfriend, Vickie (Amybeth McNulty). In the latest episodes, Will seemingly goes to Robin for advice on how to navigate his true feelings.

“There’s been so much build up to this moment,” Schnapp tells TODAY.com about Will’s coming out. “It’s been built up in my head for years, like, how are they going to write it? Who are they going to write it to? Obviously in the back of your head you know the impact it’s going to have on a lot of people in the real world struggling with similar issues of their own self identity.”
“So you just want it to be as perfect as possible, and with that comes a lot of pressure,” he adds.
Schnapp says he was able to give some input and feedback to the show's creators, Ross and Matt Duffer, and its writers.
“I did definitely give some input that kind of allowed new scenes to form from that. But for the most part, it was perfect,” he shares, before touching on whom he considers Will’s biggest supporter.

“Probably Jonathan,” he says, referring to his character's older brother. “He’s been there since the beginning and always stood by his side. You always see him understanding him and resonating with him. He never goes against him. He always wants the best for his brother.”
“I love their relationship,” Schnapp adds, “and I love seeing (Jonathan) react to that... When I saw him reacting, it got me (emotional) for sure.”
As for what’s next for Will in the finale, Episode 8 “The Rightside Up,” Schnapp says, “There’s nothing holding him back anymore.”

“You can tell, clearly, he’s been able to now harness the most strength he has because he’s come to terms with his own acceptance and accepted himself outwardly,” Schnapp says. “I’m just excited to see the part he plays in that... His own power is the power that we all have, the power of accepting yourself and believing in yourself.”
With Will now a major player in the battle against Vecna, the Duffer brothers tell TODAY.com that his superpowers were something they talked about exploring since earlier seasons.

“We knew he had this connection since Season 1 to the Upside Down, and ultimately Vecna,” Matt Duffer says, adding that the connection “was something worth exploring.” “We’ve touched on it a little bit in Season 3 and Season 4, but as we got to this final season, we started to talk about it a lot and we ended up talking about Will because everything began with Will, right?”
From his vanishing in Season 1 that kickstarted the series, they say, “It felt very organic and, in a way, inevitable to return to Will and to orient the season around him.”
So after the final episode, when the credits roll, how does Schnapp hope fans feel?

“I just want them to be satisfied like, ‘OK, these stories are finished,’” he says. “And of course they’re going to miss the characters and miss being with them, but I want them to be satisfied that those journeys have come to an end.”
“Stranger Things” Season 5, Vol. 3, drops New Year’s Eve, Dec. 31, at 5 p.m. PT/ 8 p.m. ET on Netflix.

title: Duffer Brothers Want Fans to 'Brace Themselves' Ahead of the 'Stranger Things' Series Finale
summary: Matt and Ross Duffer discuss fans' speculation that many characters will die at the end of "Stranger Things" Season 5 and what people will think after watching the final episode.
story: With only one episode left in the “Stranger Things” universe anything can happen.
Season 5 of the hit supernatural Netflix show has kept fans on the edge of their seats, emotionally preparing themselves for heartache.
Over the course of the five “Stranger Things” seasons, the show has seen several tragic deaths, including Barbara “Barb” Holland, Bob Newby and Eddie Munson.
So ahead of the Season 5 finale in Vol. 3, creators Matt and Ross Duffer, known as the Duffer brothers, address fan speculations that characters will die.

“Oh, man... I don’t know what I would say to them,” Ross Duffer tells TODAY.com. “I mean, obviously, it’s (an) emotional ending to the show for a variety of factors. But I don’t want to say too much.”
So far at the end of Vol. 2, no main character has been sacrificed — for now. But they are headed into a dangerous battle with Vecna.

“I want people to brace themselves as they go into the finale,” Ross Duffer continues. “But I can promise you it’s not a 'Red Wedding' situation, like from ‘Game of Thrones.’ We’re not gonna wipe out eight of our characters.”
Matt Duffer adds they’re “not doing anything for shock value.”
“It’ll be easier to talk about once it comes out," he added.

Amid the chatter is speculation that fan-favorite Steve Harrington, portrayed by Joe Keery, will die. The cast has weighed in on some of the fan theories, with Maya Hawke saying in an interview with the Hollywood Reporter that she’s seen fans say if Steve dies, they'll be heartbroken.
Others have poked fun at the theory.

“What if it was just the death of his hair?” Millie Bobby Brown said. “Papa comes back, shaves his hair off. Steve’s the new Eleven and actually a huge, major character death is Steve Harrington’s hair.”
When asked how they want the series finale — which airs on Netflix and in movie theaters Dec. 31 — to leave fans feeling, the Duffer brothers tell TODAY.com they're not sure.

“It’s hard to know,” says Matt Duffer. “I’m really curious to see how they react. I’m not entirely sure. I’m imagining they’re gonna feel something like we felt and the cast felt, which is this really confusing mix of emotions.”
They hope that the ending feels “inevitable” and that it's “the right ending and the right time to be ending the story, and they’ll understand that.”
However, he does note, “There’s something also sort of very sad and bittersweet about saying goodbye to these characters and this particular storyline.”
They also hope that there is a level of satisfaction amid “a big bag of emotions.”
“At least that’s based on our experience ... with the finale and the cast experience," he added.

title: 'Heated Rivalry' Episode 6 Release Time: When to Watch the Finale on HBO Max
summary: "Heated Rivalry" Season 1 ends with Episode 6. Find out the exact release time and how to watch on the day after Christmas.
story: How is "Heated Rivalry" going to follow up Episode 5?

The season's penultimate episode inspired tears and cheers in fans, as one of the show's main couples stepped into the spotlight and left the other to wonder how it might affect their own relationship.

The hockey romance series has become a phenomenon since its Nov. 28 premiere. In the series, hockey rivals Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) and Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie) start a secret romance, but their meet-ups gradually give way to real feelings.
While Season 1 is coming to an end after six episodes on Dec. 26, the series has been renewed for another season.
For now, here's what to know about watching the finale.
What Time Will Episode 6 of ‘Heated Rivalry’ Come Out?
Episode 6, which is aptly named “The Cottage,” will premiere on HBO Max at 12 a.m. ET on Friday, Dec. 26, and 9 p.m. PT on Thursday, Dec. 25.
That title is a reference to the very last line of Episode 5.

After watching hockey player Scott Hunter (Francois Arnaud) bring his love, Kip Grady (Robbie G.K.), onto the ice for a kiss after his team wins the championship, Ilya decides to take Shane up on his offer to spend weeks at his country home.
He calls Shane and says, “I’m coming to the cottage," before the episode abruptly ends.
What Else Happened in ‘Heated Rivalry’ Episode 5?
"I'll Believe in Anything," Episode 5 of "Heated Rivalry," was a moment of triumph after four aching episodes.

Shane and Ilya have a breakthrough in their own relationship. Ilya goes to Russia after his father's death. Dealing with the fallout among his family, he turns to Shane to unload. He delivers a monologue entirely in Russian that ends with him telling Shane he loves him — gasp!

Then, after Shane is injured on the ice during a match with Ilya's team, Ilya visits him in the hospital. Shane, slightly out of it after his treatment, is openly excited to see Ilya. He invites Ilya to his cottage. While Ilya is initially reluctant to go, he changes his tune after seeing another hockey player be open about his relationship with a man in a game-changing, jaw-dropping moment.

title: When Does Vol. 2 of ‘Stranger Things’ Season 5 Drop on Netflix?
summary: When is "Stranger Things" Season 5, Part 2 coming out? Find out the exact time.
story: "Stranger Things" fans have eagerly awaited a new batch of episodes from the Netflix sci-fi series' fifth and final season, and they're arriving on Dec. 25, Christmas Day.
After a grueling three-year wait, the hit show returned to Netflix on Nov. 26 when the first four episodes of Season 5 dropped. And what episodes they were!

That first Season 5 installment, which Netflix dubbed Vol. 1, saw the gang from Hawkins, Indiana, embarking on a terrifying journey back into the Upside Down. And, let's just say all hell broke loose.
Now, the hit Netflix series, which was created by twin brothers Matt and Ross Duffer, is prepared to drop three more episodes dubbed Vol. 2.

A few key things to keep in mind from Episodes 1 to 4: during a blowout brawl against an army of Demogorgons, Will (Noah Schnapp) learned he can use his freaky connection to the evil Vecna (Jamie Campbell Bower) to harness Vecna's power. A good thing since Vecna is on a mission to steal a dozen kids from Hawkins to complete his evil plan to dominate the world.

While in her coma, Max (Sadie Sink) has been a prisoner in Vecna's mind. But she's been hiding out in a cave that Vecna can't enter. After Mike and Nancy’s younger sister, Holly (Nell Fisher) falls under Vecna's spell, Max rescues her and takes her to the cave.
Also, Hawkins is under a military quarantine commandeered by scary military scientist Dr. Kay (Linda Hamilton), who's hell bent on locating Eleven (Millie Bobby Brown).

What else? Hopper (David Harbour) escaped that Russian labor camp. Dustin (Gaten Matarazzo) is grieving the death of his Dungeons & Dragons-playing pal Eddie Munson (Joseph Quinn). Nancy (Natalia Dyer), Steve (Joe Keery) and Jonathan (Charlie Heaton) are in a love triangle and Robin (Maya Hawke) has a girlfriend. Oh, and Hawkins moms Joyce (Winona Ryder) and Karen Byers (Cara Buono) are total badasses!
Read on to learn when Vol. 2 of Season 5 of "Stranger Things" arrives.
What Time Will Vol. 2 of ‘Stranger Things’ Season 5 Be Released?
Vol. 2 of Season 5 will be available on Netflix at 8 p.m. ET on Dec. 25.
How Many Episodes Will Be In Vol. 2 of Season 5?
Fans can expect to see three new episodes with the series' final episode set to air on Dec. 31.
‘Stranger Things’ Season 5 Release Schedule
Episodes 1 to 4 dropped Nov. 26 at 8 p.m. ET.Episodes 5 to 7 will arrive Dec. 25 at 8 p.m. ET.Episode 8 will arrive Dec. 31 at 8 p.m. ET.
Episodes 1 to 4 dropped Nov. 26 at 8 p.m. ET.
Episodes 5 to 7 will arrive Dec. 25 at 8 p.m. ET.
Episode 8 will arrive Dec. 31 at 8 p.m. ET.

title: Pat Finn, Star of 'Seinfeld' and 'The Middle,' Dies at 60 From Bladder Cancer
summary: Pat Finn, an actor best known for his roles on “Seinfeld” and “The Middle,” has died
story: Pat Finn, an actor best known for his roles on “Seinfeld” and “The Middle,” has died.
Finn passed away Dec. 22, at age 60 of cancer, his family members confirmed in a statement to TODAY.com.

“After a beautiful life filled with laughter, love, family, and friends, we share the heartbreaking news of the death of Pat Finn. Pat bravely battled cancer over the past few years,” the family’s statement said.
“We know heaven is going to have quite the party with Pat Finn‘s arrival,” it continued.
Finn’s loved ones said in his “final days,” he “showed the biggest signs” when the Chicago Bears scored a touchdown.

“No pressure Bears — just saying — do it for Pat,” they joked in their statement, adding, “His life and legacy will be carried on through his beautiful family, including his wife Donna and three children, Cassidy, Caitlin and Ryan, and the thousands of friends and family that he impacted.”
What Type of Cancer Did Pat Finn Have?
Finn was diagnosed in 2022 with bladder cancer, according to  Deadline. The cancer went into remission but later returned and metastasized, the website reported.
What is Bladder Cancer?
Bladder cancer is a common type of cancer that begins in the urothelial cells that line the inside of the bladder, according to the Mayo Clinic.
Bladder cancers are often diagnosed at an early stage when they are highly treatable. However, even after successful treatment, early-stage bladder cancers can return.
Symptoms of bladder cancer scan include:
Blood in urineFrequent urinationPainful urinationBack pain
Blood in urine
Frequent urination
Painful urination
Back pain
What TV Shows and Movies Was Pat Finn Best Known For as an Actor?
Finn got his professional start as a comic actor when he joined Chicago’s Second City and iO comedy troupes following his graduation from Marquette University in 1987.

After landing guest parts in the mid-1990s on “Murphy Brown” and “The George Wendt Show,” Finn landed the role of Joe Mayo, a friend who hosts a housewarming party only to have Elaine accidentally throw out his fur coat in the “The Reverse Peephole” episode of “Seinfeld.”

The Evanston, Indiana-born actor went on to appear in recurring roles on multiple episodes of “Friends,” “Third Rock From The Sun” and “Ed,” and also played the friendly neighbor Bill Norwood in 23 episodes of ABC’s “The Middle.”
Finn also appeared in the movies “Dude, Where’s My Car,” “I Love You, Beth Cooper” and “It’s Complicated.”

title: Kate Middleton and Princess Charlotte Play the Piano Together to Celebrate Christmas
summary: Catherine, the Princess of Wales, and her daughter Princess Charlotte teamed up for a special duet.
story: Catherine, the Princess of Wales, and her daughter Princess Charlotte teamed up for a special duet.

On Christmas Eve, the official social media accounts for the Prince and Princess of Wales released a video that showed the royal mother-daughter duo performing a special rendition of Holm Sound by Erland Cooper on the piano.
The performance is part of the opening for the holiday celebration “Royal Carols: Together at Christmas,” airing on Dec. 24.
As the 10-year-old and her mother sit at the grand piano, the former Kate Middleton shares a message with viewers.
“At its heart, Christmas speaks of love taking form in the simplest, most human ways,” Kate says in the voiceover. “Not in sentimental or grand gestures, but gentle ones.”

“A moment of listening, a word of comfort, a friendly conversation, a helping hand, presence, these simple acts of care might seem small,” she continues. “But they contribute to the beautiful tapestry of life to which we all belong.”
As scenes of people coming together and celebrating the holiday appear on the screen, Kate shares how Christmas is a time that reminds people how “deeply our lives are woven together.”
The sweet video concludes with Kate wishing people a “very happy Christmas,” as their duet also comes to an end.

Earlier this year, in an episode of Apple TV’s “The Reluctant Traveler With Eugene Levy,” Prince William shared that his daughter, as well as sons Prince George and Prince Louis, were learning how to play musical instruments.

“(We're) keeping them busy with sports and just being outdoors is really important. They’re trying to learn musical instruments. I’m not sure how successful we’re being with that,” he told host Eugene Levy.
He also added that Charlotte’s favorite activities included netball and ballet.
Kate, meanwhile, has been back to her royal duties and outings after revealing her cancer diagnosis in March 2024. She is now in remission.

In July of this year, per video footage from the BBC, she touched on adjusting to normal life after treatment, saying, “You put on a sort of brave face (with) stoicism through treatment. (When) treatment’s done, then it’s like, ‘I can crack on, get back to normal again.’”
Prince William also touched on how their kids coped with his wife’s diagnosis, telling Levy in that same episode, “We try to make sure you give them the security and the safety that they need.”

"And we’re a very open family, so we talk about things that bother us and things that trouble us,” he said. “But you never quite know the knock-on effects it can have. So it’s just important to be there for each other and to, kind of, reassure the children that everything’s OK.”

title: How to Watch the Pope's Christmas Eve Mass Tonight on NBC
summary: How to watch Pope Leo XIV's first Christmas Eve mass at St. Peter's Basilica at the Vatican in Rome on December 24, 2025.
story: Pope Leo XIV will preside over his first Christmas Eve mass at St. Peter’s Basilica at the Vatican in Rome on Dec. 24.

The 69-year-old Chicago native is the first leader of the Roman Catholic Church to hail from the United States. He was as elected by a conclave in May 2025 after the death of Pope Francis on April 21.
Coverage of Pope Leo XIV's first Christmas Eve mass will air on NBC. Read on for details.
What Time Is Pope Leo’s First Christmas Eve Mass?
Pope Leo XIV’s first Christmas Eve mass held inside St. Peter’s Basilica at the Vatican will begin airing on Dec. 24 at 11:30 p.m. ET on NBC.
The coverage of the mass will air for approximately 90 minutes.
The coverage will begin after NBC's annual airing of the holiday classic "It’s a Wonderful Life," starring Jimmy Stewart, from 8 p.m. ET until 11:30 p.m. ET.
What Is Special About the Mass?
The Christmas Eve mass is a milestone for the Roman Catholic Church. It's the first service presided over by the new pope, who is the first pope from the United States.
The late Pope Francis, who died in April 2025, presided over the previous five Christmas Eve masses.
What Has Pope Leo XIV Said About Christmas?
Pope Leo XIV spoke about the meaning of Christmas — and what he considered the perfect holiday gift — when he addressed the youth group Italian Catholic Action on Dec. 20.
“Before the holy night of Christmas, think of someone with whom you can make peace,” he told the group, according to the Catholic News Agency.
“It will be a gift more valuable than those you can buy in stores, because peace is a gift that is truly found only in the heart," he added.

title: Chevy Chase Say He Felt 'Hurt' Being Left Out of 'SNL' 50th Anniversary Special
summary: Chevy Chase is breaking his silence about how “hurt” he was to be left out of the televised “SNL50: The Anniversary Special” earlier this year
story: Chevy Chase is breaking his silence about how “hurt” he was to be left out of the televised “SNL50: The Anniversary Special” earlier this year.
Chase, 82, was an original cast member of NBC’s live sketch comedy show in 1975 before leaving the show in its second season to focus on a successful movie career.

Now, the comedy legend reveals in the upcoming CNN Films  documentary “I’m Chevy Chase and You’re Not,” out Jan. 1, 2026, that not being included in the show’s live three-hour birthday bash on Feb. 16 was a disappointment.

“Well, it was kind of upsetting, actually,” Chase says in the documentary. “This is probably the first time I’m saying it. But I expected that I would’ve been on the stage too with all the other actors. When Garrett (Morris) and Laraine (Newman) went on the stage there, I was curious as to why I didn’t. No one asked me to. Why was I left aside?”
The “National Lampoon’s Vacation” star, who did attend the special with wife Jayni Chase, goes on to say he later broached the subject with “SNL” creator and producer Lorne Michaels.

“I did bring it up once in a text to Lorne and then took it back,” he says. “I said, ‘OK, I take it back, silly.’ But it’s not that silly. Somebody’s made a bad mistake there. I don’t know who it was, but somebody made a mistake. They should’ve had me on that stage. It hurt.”

Chase, who was the first to anchor the show’s “Weekend Update” segment, also points out in the doc that Bill Murray, 75, who took over the segment when he joined “SNL” in Season 2, also hosted the “Weekend Update” portion of the birthday special.
“Why was Bill Murray there and why was I not?” asks Chase. “I don’t have an answer for that.”
Chase's wife also expressed her frustration about her husband's omission from the milestone celebration.
“They told Chevy up until that day that there were two bits (and) they were going back and forth,” she says in the upcoming doc. “And then all of a sudden, there’s no bit.”
“I’m Chevy Chase and You’re Not” premieres on Jan. 1 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CNN.

title: Travis Kelce Reveals the Gift He Bought That's 'One of Tay's Favorite'
summary: Travis Kelce says a bread slicer he bought Taylor Swift is one of the best gifts he's ever gotten for the singer.
story: Taylor Swift is in her bread era.
So it's only fitting that the best gift she's received from her fiancé, Travis Kelce, helps with her new hobby.

“I will say one of Tay’s favorite gifts that I got her was the bread slicer,” he told his brother, Jason Kelce, and Jason’s wife, Kylie, during the brothers’ Christmas Eve episode of their “New Heights” podcast.
Travis Kelce explained he got the gift because Swift has “been throwing together so much f------ sourdough.”
“Got the best gut health there is. I love you, Tay,” he added.
Jason Kelce seconded the thought behind his brother's gift.
“One of the unfortunate things with making fresh bread is trying to cut that s---. It is hard. The slicer makes a big deal,” Jason Kelce said.
“More importantly, the responsibility to eat it,” Kylie Kelce joked.
Swift’s love of baking is well known. When she appeared on “New Heights” in August, she opened up about her interest in sourdough.
“I’m really talking about bread 60% of the time now. It’s become a huge, huge factor,” she said.

She revealed that she's asked friends to critique her culinary creations. Travis Kelce added he also appreciates her fondness for baking, saying he’s asked her to make sourdough for him to take to training camp.
“You got me deep in this!” he told Swift.

Swift’s affinity for baking has included her sending a bread basket to pal Selena Gomez and husband Benny Blanco while they were engaged, along with the message “It’s a loaf story,” a tongue-in-cheek reference to her smash hit “Love Story.”

The “Fate of Ophelia” singer has also baked cinnamon rolls as a pregame meal for Travis, as well as homemade Pop-Tarts for his Kansas City Chiefs teammates. And every fall, her 2014 recipe for chai sugar cookies resurfaces on social media.

title: Who Is Venus Williams' Husband, Andrea Preti?
summary: Venus Williams is married to Andrea Preti. The two were married in two ceremonies in 2025. Here's what to know about Preti including his age and job.
story: Venus Williams has scored a love match, and it’s off the court. The tennis star has tied the knot twice in 2025 to husband Andrea Preti.
The pair initially got married in Ischia, Italy on Sept. 18 and then held a second wedding in a courthouse ceremony last weekend in Palm Beach, Florida.

“We had this dream to do our wedding in Italy,” Williams told Vogue. “But we didn’t have enough time to do the paperwork — because I’m a foreigner, it can take about eight months. So we decided to have a second wedding.”
The couple first met at the Gucci show during Milan Fashion Week in 2024.

“I saw V and wanted to introduce myself,” Preti told Vogue. “She was on the sofa with her friends and family. I told her, ‘You’re so beautiful,’ and then she started speaking with me in Italian. We had a little talk, and I asked if she wanted a drink. I went to the bar to get something, and her sister Lyn came to me and said, ‘Do you mind if we start a WhatsApp conversation? I think my sister likes you.’”
The relationship took off from there, with them meeting up in England. Williams quickly realized he was the man for her.

“We wanted to be discreet at the time, but he really took care of me,” she told Vogue. “After our dates in London, I just knew I was going to marry him. People always say they just know, and I just knew.”
On July 22 of this year, following her first singles match in more than a year, Williams revealed that she was engaged to the former actor and model.
While speaking to WTA following her DC Open singles match, the tennis star, who sported a diamond ring on her left finger, called Preti her fiancé.
“My fiancé is here and he really encouraged me to keep playing,” she explained, noting it was the first time Preti had seen her play.
Williams made her first public appearance with Preti in 2024. There’s plenty to learn about the man who won big in the tennis star’s heart.
Read on to learn all about Andre Preti.
He’s Originally From Denmark
Andrea Preti was born in Copenhagen, Denmark, on June 6, 1988, according to his IMDB page, making him 37 years old.
He’s Lived In Italy
As a teenager, Preti moved with his family to Italy, where he was first introduced to the world of fashion, per his IMDB page.
He’s a Former Model
While living in Italy, Preti decided to pursue modeling full-time and eventually became a familiar face in the modeling industry.
In an interview with Affashionate.com, Preti shared that his first modeling job was for Gucci. “It was a presentation that involved boutiques all over Italy,” he explained.
During his career, he walked the runway for John Richmond at Milan Fashion Week for both the Spring/Summer 2013 and Autumn/Winter 2013 collections.
Still, Preti has said in the past that modeling wasn’t his original aim. Speaking to Affashionate.com, he explained that it was his parents who urged him to consider the catwalk.

“I never dreamed of doing fashion. My parents push me to do that,” he explained. “In the beginning, I went to several agencies showing my photos, but they were so bad that I was not even considered. Then my father let me introduce myself to Domenico Zambelli, he carried me by Bruno, from the D Management, who told me these words: ‘The pictures are disgusting, but I believe in you.’ And from there it all started. However, I owe it all to Domenico.”
Preti has modeled for top fashion houses like Dolce & Gabbana, Moncler, and Corneliani.

Now, a decade later, the actor remains tied to the fashion world, having attended the Gucci Men’s Spring/ Summer 2025 show in Milan in June 2024, where he was spotted sitting in the front row at the event. He often posts about some of the campaigns he’s worked on, such as collaborating with Tommy Hilfiger in Florence, Italy.
He Studied Acting in New York
On the heels of his modeling success, Preti relocated to New York City to attend the Susan Baston Academy, where he trained to become a professional actor.
He’s an Actor and Producer
Preti’s IMDb page notes that he has worked in film, television, and commercials, and has starred in various projects, as well as taken on roles as a producer.

Some of his projects include “One More Day” (2015), “Detective per Caso” (2018), “My Beloved Enemy” (2018), which he also produced, “Girls to Buy” (2021), “Temptation” (2023), and a 2021 television series titled “A Professor.”
He and Venus Williams Were Spotted Together in 2024

The couple were seen enjoying each other’s company during a trip to Nerano, Italy along the Amalfi Coast back in July 2024, according to People. The two caught rays and attention while appearing happy on a boat ride.
Their Love Language
While they have kept much of their relationship private, Williams and Preti’s social media interactions offer a glimpse into their chemistry and connection.
In June, Preti offered a glimpse into their multilingual banter when he shared a promotional post from a Tommy Hilfiger modeling campaign on Instagram.

The post included a carousel of photos of the actor modeling clothing for the brand. In the comments section of the post, Williams wrote “le mien," French for “mine.” Preti replied with “si,” the Italian word for “yes.”
Venus Confirmed Her Engagement to Preti in July 2025
In February 2025, Williams and Preti set off rumors of their engagement when the tennis star was seen in Rome wearing a diamond ring on her engagement finger.

At the time, People obtained photos of Williams and Preti having a PDA moment outside. The outlet also zoomed in on a photo of Williams wearing a diamond ring during a training session. Despite all signs pointing to an engagement, neither had publicly confirmed that they were gearing up to tie the knot.
On July 22, the tennis star confirmed her engagement to the actor after her Mubadala Citi DC Open singles match.
“My fiancé is here and he really encouraged me to keep playing,” Williams said during an interview with WTA after her match in which she spoke about his support of her and the sport.

“There were so many times where I just wanted to coast and kind of chill,” she said during the interview. “Do you know how hard it is to play tennis? You guys don’t know how much work goes into this, like it’s 9 to 5 except you’re running the whole time, lifting weights and just like dying and then you repeat it the next day.”
"So he encouraged me to get through this, and it’s wonderful to be here. He’s never seen me play,” she added.

title: Why You Can't Stop Thinking About 'Heated Rivalry' Episode 5
summary: "Heated Rivalry" fans explain why the episode went viral and why its impact has been so widespread. What happened in the episode?
story: Francis Dominic, a content creator based in Los Angeles, watches episodes of “Heated Rivalry” the moment they drop on HBO Max. When he saw the fifth episode, he knew he wanted to watch it again — this time, with a crowd.
“I was like, 'Listen, I have to experience this with people,'” Dominic tells TODAY.com.
Dominic headed to a local gay sports bar that has been airing episodes of the romance novel adaptation since Episode 3, demonstrating the snowball effect the show has had since its Nov. 28 premiere.

In his videos from the evening, the crowd cheers during the last scene as if they were experiencing a live sporting event. Other reactions flooding social media are similarly euphoric, with people saying they're watching it "like it's the Super Bowl."
But why has Episode 5 in particular led to such an outpouring of love? Here’s what to know.
What Is ‘Heated Rivalry’?
Based on Rachel Reid’s "Game Changers" romance novel series, two hockey all-stars fall for each other in “Heated Rivalry.”
Situated within a league that has no openly queer players, Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie) and Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) feel trapped, especially as their feelings for each other grow.
Full of longing and NSFW scenes, the series has been hailed as a perfect romance novel adaptation by fans and has brought new ones into the fold, hence the crowd at Francis’ local bar.
What Happens in Episode 5 of 'Heated Rivalry'?

Episode 5 continues the dramatic highs and lows of Shane and Ilya. Notable moments include Shane ending his relationship with Rose Landry, Shane getting hurt and taken off the ice on a stretcher with a distraught Ilya looking on, and Ilya confessing he loves Shane (that is, in Russian, a monologue that “Heated Rivalry” fans who are native Russian speakers are especially loving.)
But in its final few moments, after four episodes of angst, there's a reprieve, one that fans experienced with joy — and documented for social media.
To explain it, we have to go back to Episode 3, which took a detour from Shane and Ilya’s story to focus on another hockey player, New York star Scott Hunter (Francois Arnaud).

While he’s older than Shane and Ilya, who are both in their mid-20s, he's struggling with the same issue. His meet-cute with an aspiring art historian named Kip (Robbie G.K.) led to a real love, but he feels unable to come out. With Kip tired of living under the shadow of a secret romance, they're at a standstill.

Then comes the ending of Episode 5, when Scott’s New York Admirals win the Stanley Cup. As his teammates embrace friends and family on the ice, Scott moves to the edge of the rink and scans the crowd, looking for someone.

Shane and Ilya watch the moment unfold on the TV. That means the fictional characters and the "Heated Rivalry" audience experience the shock of what Scott does next: He gestures for Kip to come down to the ice. Then, he kisses him on live TV.
Meanwhile, Shane and Ilya seemingly have their own revelations of what this might mean for their relationship.
At the end of the episode, Ilya calls Shane and takes him up on his offer to spend two weeks alone at his home. For the first time in years, they'll have quality together.
The episode ends with Ilya telling Shane, “I’m coming to the cottage.”
Why Is Episode 5 Such a Big Deal?
While “Heated Rivalry” has been building momentum since its premiere, Episode 5 has inspired a particular outpouring of emotion.

Ronald Charles Chavis filmed his husband, Refeal Shtivi, weeping after watching the episode in a video shared to TikTok. Speaking to TODAY.com, the couple say the episode’s “grand gesture” reminded them of their own story. Shtivi was encouraged to come out to the wider world after meeting Chavis in 2023.
“This coming out part in front of so many people, I did myself. I felt like the big release they were having. I felt super connected with that,” Shtivi says.
“Gay, straight — people want to know that they’re loved,” Chavis adds. “That was the beauty in that episode."
Chavis calls the episode “cathartic” for viewers, especially after the four episodes of build-up.

“It was such a such a release for them that everybody watching that episode felt it. Because at one point it felt like we were all holding our breath, waiting, and when he did that, it was like it was a sign that everything was going to be OK,” Chavis says.

Dominic points to the widespread pop culture phenomenon of  LGTBQ love stories ending in tragedy. Instead, at the end of “Heated Rivalry” Episode 5, a gay love story is “loudly celebrated" as the crowd in the stadium cheers, too.

“What was so great about it is that we finally got a huge happily ever after,” Dominic says. “When I watched it by myself, I was sobbing, because it’s like we are constantly fighting for our happily ever after.”
For Dominic, Episode 5’s ending is meta, with consequences reverberating both in the show and in the real world.

“I think seeing Scott choose Kip and bringing him on the ice was so triumphant, because sometimes that just never happens either in real life or in media portraits of gays in their relationship,” he says.
“Hopefully people will be inspired to live the truth that they’ve always wanted to," he said. "If this is what’s happening right now mainstream media, I’m like, why can’t it happen in real life?”

title: Sophia James Looks Back at 1 of the Biggest Moments of 2025 — Which She Created
summary: Sophia James opens up about life after Group 7 and her new album.
story: Singer-songwriter Sophia James is responsible for one of the major internet moments of 2025: Group 7, a social media experiment that went extremely viral.
Back in October, James posted seven TikTok videos assigning people to groups one through seven, with her her single “So Unfair" playing in the background.
Thanks to the mystery of the algorithm, one of the videos went off. “If you’re watching this video, you are in group 7,” James said in the 7th video, which amassed 85.6 million views.
What followed was not just a viral moment, but a turning point for James' career, leading to a New York Times profile an in-person group 7 event in Los Angeles.
What comes after group 7? A lot, James says.
Life before and after ‘group 7’
Before her viral moment, James describes her career as an independent artist as “pretty stagnant.”

She graduated from UCLA with a degree in jazz. “I just knew that I wanted to do music my whole life,” she tells TODAY.com. “I figured if I had a good understanding of jazz theory and practice, I could translate it easily to whatever genre I chose.”
Since college, she has worked all over the music industry, from session pianist to backup vocalist to touring opener and keyboardist.
“I’ve had my hands in about 10 different pies at any given point, with the intention of making the solo artist career full-time,” James says.

As an independent artist, social media was the "only tool in her arsenal" for getting her own music out into the world — but she did not expect her impulsive batch of videos to blow up. She says she was “just trying things and feeling silly,” so she was shocked when the seventh video took off.

This journey and group 7 have not only changed her goals, but the scale of her audience and the reach of her music. James gained over 100,000 TikTok followers after going viral, according to The New York Times.

The viral moment also helped James catch the attention of SiriusXM’s Mikey Piff, who discovered her song “So Unfair” through the group 7 video. James explains that Piff emailed her asking to play her on the station.
“I was like, that’s crazy — I never, ever thought I would ever have a song on the radio,” James says. “I consider that the pinnacle of a music career.”
James says “So Unfair” then transferred over to the Hits 1 station because of the positive response to the song.
“And so that’s been really unbelievable and very massive,” James says.
Still, life after group 7 can come with pressure. James says she has felt some expectations to recreate the viral success, but she knows it was a “lightning in a bottle” moment.
“I will never top the group 7 video, at least on social media,” she says. “That is my magnum opus on social media.”
New year, new music

James says if people want more excitement, they should turn to her music. Instead of chasing another viral hit, James is focused on building her future. She says her upcoming album, to be released in 2026, represents a creative shift.
“It’s definitely the most explorative I’ve ever been in music,” she explains. “It’s very absurd and playful in a lot of ways, and it’s been really fun to explore that side of artistry.”
James says earlier songs were more “deeply existential and grim,” where the new album is a lot more “explosive.” She feels all the feelings, ranging from anger to humor.
“To be an artist you don’t have to be tortured,” James says. “You can also be a trickster, you can be playful and excited and angry.”

These feelings in her music are inspired by lived experience, relationships and music she’s listened to across eras. In her mind, these are songs that could be enjoyed and on the radio 15 years ago or 15 years from now.
Much of her upcoming album was shaped by the two years she spent writing it, a period filled with “a lot of living.”
“I feel like I have the freedom to dream bigger than I have felt like I was allowed to in a long while,” James says.
Going forward, James hopes to spend as much time on the road as possible. “I want to tour forever,” she says. “So come hang.”
In other words — we're all in group 7 now.

title: The Best Books to Read This December, According to John Searles
summary: There's nothing like than cozying up with a book in holiday pajamas, the glow of a Christmas tree and crackle of an roaring fire creating the perfect mood.
story: There's nothing like than cozying up with a book in holiday pajamas, the glow of a Christmas tree and crackle of an roaring fire creating the perfect mood.

To make the most of this peak reading environment, author John Searles, who is releasing his next book "Single Girls" in July 2026, has readers covered with the top book recommendations this holiday season.
Keep reading to discover his picks, which he shared on the 3rd Hour of TODAY, and what he has to say about each book.
"The Holiday Grump" by Enni Amanda

Taking place in the cozy small-town of Hideaway Harbor, a runaway bride and a bookseller are friends with benefits until the line starts to blur. Perfect for fans of grump/sunshine and forced proximity.

"This sweet and spicy tale has all the key ingredients for a fun holiday love story," Searles says, including "a runaway bride," "a grumpy but gorgeous bookstore owner" and "a cozy town with more Christmas decorations per square foot than a Hallmark movie."
When Noelle leaves her husband-to-be behind and ends up in the small town of Hideaway Harbor with a gig selling Christmas bulbs for the season, she ends up connecting with a bookstore owner.
"Good Spirits" by B.K. Borison
This twist on A Christmas Carol explores the idea of the Ghost of Christmas Past as the love interest in a rom com.
In this book, a woman is hosted by the Ghost of Christmas Past ... but he's not anything like the depiction from Charles Dickens' "Christmas Carol."

"In this book, the ghost is a quietly handsome and rugged former sailor named Nolan, who’s caught between this life and the next and given the job of haunting people and showing them their past," Searles says. "When he meets a sweet and charming woman named Harriet, he finds himself suddenly wishing for a future…with her."
"A Christmas Carol (Deluxe Gift Edition)" by Charles Dickens
In this classic Christmas tale, Ebenezer Scrooge hates Christmas until three ghosts bring him to pivotal moments throughout his life to show him the true meaning of Christmas.
Discover the Christmas classic with Peter Pauper Press, whohas published this deluxe gift edition with classic illustrations.

"Dickens was known to be a social critic and it’s clear he intended this story to also be a commentary on the divide between the rich and the poor, which is felt more acutely during the holiday season," Searles says.
"The Polar Express: 40th Anniversary Edition" by Chris Van Allsburg

A young boy hops a train to the North Pole for the ultimate adventure to learn the true spirit of Christmas. This book was also, of course, adapted into a beloved holiday film to watch after reading the book.
"The movie has become such a holiday classic that I think some people out there don’t even realize it was originally based on a gorgeous children’s book," Searles says.
The original book has a "quiet magic" about it. Venture along as a young boy discovers a train to the North Pole outside his house.
"The Award" by Matthew Pearl
This thrilling page-turner about how a struggling author navigates fame in the literary world will have readers on the edge of their seats.
"We all know tensions can flare at a holiday party… but in this captivating thriller, the tension is so ratcheted up it leads to a shocking murder," Searles says.
"A dark, gripping read. I cracked it open on a long plane ride and did not stop until I finished. I loved it."

title: Taylor Swift Reads Aloud a Romantic Letter from Travis Kelce in 'Eras Tour' Doc. What It Says
summary: In the finale episode of "The End of an Era" docuseries, Taylor Swift reads aloud a note that Travis Kelce wrote her.
story: Taylor Swift is sharing a sneak peek at a sweet note Travis Kelce wrote her ahead of her final “Eras Tour” concerts.

In the final episode of her six-part “The End of an Era” docuseries, the pop star gets nostalgic as she wraps a special era on the road. As emotions run high, her Kansas City Chiefs star fiancé sends her a message telling her how thankful he is for the record-breaking tour that brought them together.
Backstage in her green room, with just three shows left, Swift sits on a couch next to a bouquet of white roses and reads a letter Kelce wrote her.

“So many unbelievable memories on this tour, but my favorite one is seeing you in concert for the first time, being ... mesmerized and swept off my feet by a woman who doesn’t even know me,” she quotes with a laugh, reading the note out loud. “I selfishly say thank you for creating this legendary tour and to Robert for making you stop through Kansas City, Missouri.”
“That night, too, in KC, was the beginning of me meeting the love of my life...” she continues, before reading the rest to herself.
After reading it, she says, “Ohhh, my god. So much for no emotions on the last three shows, huh?”

As Swifties know, the Chiefs tight end attended Swift's concert at his team’s home stadium in July 2023. Then during his “New Heights” podcast, he shared that he tried and failed to give Swift a bracelet with his phone number on it.
Behind the scenes, the two started connecting and rumors of a romance brewing ignited when Swift attended her first Chiefs game in September 2023.
Just over two years after Kelce attended that fateful Swift concert, the pair announced their engagement in August 2025.
During Swift’s first appearance on “New Heights," Swift touched on how the podcast and her tour brought them together.
“This podcast has done a lot for me. I owe a lot to this podcast. This podcast got me a boyfriend ever since Travis decided to use it as his personal dating app about two years ago,” she joked.
When Kelce's brother, Jason Kelce, asked if she ever got the bracelet Travis Kelce made for her, she replied, “I’ve never seen the original.”

“It was such a wild romantic gesture to just be like, ‘I want to date you!’” she said, later adding, “This is sort of what I’ve been writing songs about wanting to happen to me since I was a teenager.”

title: 'Heated Rivalry' Is Getting People Into Hockey. Here's What the NHL Thinks
summary: “Heated Rivalry” is one of the must-see shows of the season, bringing hockey fans and those who weren’t as familiar with the sport together to watch two rival hockey players fall in love.
story: “Heated Rivalry” is one of the must-see shows of the season, bringing hockey fans and those who weren’t as familiar with the sport together to watch two rival hockey players fall in love.
